data.title: !B (Tools) Wwise SDK installation expects new directory structure.
data.body:
Latest python script is not working anymore, usually people has installed cryengine under "Program files(x86)" which contains spaces. Also the old structure under SDKs\Audio\wwise is not the same that wwise project in visual studio solution is using. This patch copies the Wwise SDK folder to the expected SDKs\Audio\wwise folder and allow compile Wwise.

A README.txt file has been added with info and tips on how to use it.

data.title: !B (System) Wrong warning missing thread configuration when only common configuration is defined
data.body: If only common configuration is defined in the thread configuration file, the sytem was loading it and then trying to load some CPU dependant configuration. If not found, it was showing a warning about platform not being defined. Common configuration was loaded but ignored when checking the loaded condition.
new pull update

data.title: Fix for locked head rotation in mp.
data.body:
Added destinction between local and remote clients so the head rotation of remote clients isnÂ´t locked towards 0,0,0.
The view matrix is ofc always invalid for remote clients so the raycast returns a collison with terrain at 0,0,0 making the head always point in that direction.
Also maybe consider specifying IsClient seperately and outside of IsThirdPerson since it can lead to confusion.

data.title: Fixing Asynchronous Time Warp on OSVR
Fix shader input layout for DirectX 10+
Main
data.body: publish 5.2 cryengine source on github

data.title: Use cross-platform path separator for steam_api.h in CrySteamStats.h
Prevent segfault in DX12 renderer
data.body:
Check the value of ID3D12Resource::Map to prevent segfaulting. It's quite inconsistent to replicate but running a scene while shaders are compiling seems to be the best recipe for causing ID3D12Resource::Map to fail.

Note that I did have other issues and crashes unless the shaders were completely compiled so there is probably an underlying issue for which an assertion or fatal error would be better, but it seems reasonable to me to nullptr check.

data.title: Update DeviceWrapper12.cpp
data.body: Clang complains about calling delete instead of delete[] on vertexStreams

data.title: Three Mouse Position Nodes
data.body:
Here is three mouse position nodes.
Input:GetMousePos
Input:SetMousePos
Input:LockMousePos

data.title: Multiple Camera rendering fixes
data.body:
Added support for culling thread to check multiple cameras (barring the coverage buffer). This has been tested for my WIP split-screen support (not sent in yet) based on the Stereo 3D / VR rendering.

This PR also fixes a bunch of pre-culling visibility / distance checks to properly check multiple cameras if they are available.

I've introduced a few new CCamera helpers that should be used in order to make sure that new functionality also adheres to multi-cam support.

Let me know if there's anything you guys would do differently!

data.title: IFlashUI SendEvent variadic function
data.body: Uses variadic functions to not limit you to just 8 arguments.

data.title: Fix WAF configure failure if MSBUILD is at default location but VS atâ¦
data.body:
Fix issue where MSBUILD directory would fail to be found if Visual Studio was installed at a custom location, but MSBUILD is still in its default installation directory. 

Maybe detection for VS vs MSBUILD should be separated?

Caused heap corruptions on PC and PS4 for our use case.

data.title: Support lambdas in console commands
data.body: Support standard C++ lambdas in console commands themselves. Given that Visual Studio 2015 is the minimum supported version and Clang/GCC both have supported lambdas for some time, it should be supported in all CryEngine-supported configurations. If supporting lambdas in the console registration functions is desired, I can amend my pull request with the same thing for variable setting.

data.title: Fix console double paste issue
data.body:
Removed DXInput clipboard paste handling as I've noticed that XConsole already have a more generic/better implementation of clipboard paste.
DXInput would simply "simulate" user typing in clipboard data whenever CTRL+V was detected, then XConsole would get an InputEvent with CTRL+V and copy clipboard data into input buffer and that would result in double paste.

data.title: Added null renderer checks to OpticsManager, FogVolumeRenderNode, andâ¦
data.body: â¦ ClipVolumeProxy to prevent dedicated server crashes

data.title: Fix case of dangling pointer use in RenderObject
data.body:
Moved over from 3.8.6 project, possible crash would occur on render thread after material is deleted on game thread while the material was queued for rendering. Simply making sure that the render thread manages material references fixes the issue.

There were a few other changes required in the 3.8.6 build, but those are already part of 5.1.

Note that this hasn't been extensively tested in the 5.1 branch!

data.title: Improved RayCast and RayCastCamera flow nodes.
data.body: Added ability to specify which object types should cause a hit. Also removed unnecessary flow node entity assignment in RayCastCamera node since it doesn't use a target entity.

data.title: [BUGFIX][GNU/Linux] Compile errors, memory leaks ...
data.body:
Hi CryEngine Team

Here are some fixes I encountered when I tired to compile the CryEngine on Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit.
Here a list of fixes.
1. At some points the sizeof(this) was used. I assume this is not intended. It should be *this if the size of the structure is meant. (GraphicsPipelineStateSet.h, GeomCacheRenderNode.cpp)
2. 'override' operator missing. 
3. In CreateVariable, CreateArray in the FlashUIElement, I think a endless loop was caused because the wrong parameter was used.
4. fabsf compile errors.
5. [-Werror,-Wshift-negative-value] compile errors. Some occurred in the SDLs projects like zlib etc. Maybe for clang the script compile_settings_clang.pyc can have the '-Wno-shift-negative-value' flag. Better all issues should be fixed.
6. In DeviceWrapper12 wrong usage of the delete operator. I think it should be delete [].
##### NOTE:

In the SDK's folder there is a project called yasli. There is a file TypeID.h, the line  174

`#elif __GNUC__ >= 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 4`

must be replaced. The preprocessor flags are used wrong. When compiling the CryEngine with gcc that part will not be used. Here my suggestion (or from GNU Team), use:

`#define GCC_VERSION (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)`

and replace line 174 with: 

`#elif GCC_VERSION > 40400`

This file has even more issues and asserts at s==send. I made a bug report about those #defines on the yasli project file and it seems they fixed it. Furthermore it has some fixes that causes an assert s==send. Using the new TypeID.h fixes this issue.
Furthermore the SDK zip file has issues with some files because soft links to some files are not packed correct. I had to redo the soft linking by hand.

Hope you consider those fixes or at least look at them.

data.title: (ActionMapManager) Forced controller device opt-in and added warningâ¦
data.body:
When GameZero was released, I noticed that controller devices were getting mapped despite a typo in the action profile xml. The existing source code is set up to automatically map devices unless the xml specifically opts out. That's fine, I guess, but every other event system within the engine requires you to opt into receiving events. This change brings the Action Map Manager's initialization in line with the rest of the engine in that regard and provides warnings in the log file for designers who make typos.

If this PR is accepted, the GameZero default profile would need an Oculus Touch attribute for the PC platform. A warning will be generated in game.log similar to the following:

08:30:26 [Warning] CActionMapManager::InitActionMaps: Platform 'PC' tag does not contain attribute oculustouch, device will not be mapped

data.title: Partial OS X Support - Engine launches and can run, no rendering (yet)
data.body: Made it possible to build and run the engine on OS X, does not add support for the ancient OpenGL version that OS X currently requires however (thus rendering will be mostly broken).

data.title: Zeph main
data.body:
When GameZero was released, I noticed that controller devices were getting mapped despite a typo in the action profile xml.  The existing source code is set up to automatically map devices unless the xml specifically opts out.  That's fine, I guess, but every other event system within the engine requires you to opt into receiving events.  This change brings the Action Map Manager's initialization in line with the rest of the engine in that regard and provides warnings in the log file for designers who make typos.

If this PR is accepted, the GameZero default profile would need an Oculus Touch attribute for the PC platform.  A warning will be generated in game.log similar to the following:
08:30:26 [Warning] CActionMapManager::InitActionMaps:  Platform 'PC' tag does not contain attribute oculustouch, device will not be mapped
